title.value: Development of a Cost-Efficient Scintillation-Fiber Detector for Use in Automated Synthesis of Positron Emission Tomography Radiotracers
title.justification: The title provided discusses the development of a scintillation-fiber detector related to PET radiotracers, aligning with the content of the paper.
title.quote: DEVELOPMENT OF A COST-EFFICIENT SCINTILLATION-FIBER DETECTOR FOR USE IN AUTOMATED SYNTHESIS OF POSITRON EMISSION TOMOGRAPHY RADIOTRACERS

extractions.description: The paper focuses on creating a low-cost scintillation-fiber detector for improving the synthesis of PET radiotracers. The development aims to reduce costs associated with radiotracer production by optimizing the detector configuration and integrating it into automated synthesis modules.

type.justification: The paper describes the empirical development and testing of a scintillation-fiber detector to modify production processes for PET radiotracers.
type.quote: The objective of this work was to develop a multichannel detector using low-cost scintillating fibers and silicon photomultipliers (SiPMs) to allow monitoring of the transfer of radioactivity throughout the process.

name.justification: The development of detectors for PET scans links directly to advancements in medical imaging technologies.
name.quote: Radiolabelling is a critical step in positron emission tomography (PET) radiotracer production, involving complex multistep chemical reactions.

name.justification: Radiology is involved as the research deals with imaging techniques related to PET scans.
name.quote: The scintillation fiber detector provides a cost-efficient solution to troubleshoot the automated synthesis of PET radiotracers.
